intro: Ophrys spruneri f. galactostictos, commonly known as the Galactostictos Orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which mimics the appearance of female wasps to attract male pollinators. The plant features a single, showy flower with intricate patterns and a distinctive, elongated spur. Its leaves are typically broad and grass-like, and it thrives in calcareous soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
